page.title: 07Gristhorpe,general.
page.content: The main street with it's 17th and 18th century buildings is a conservation area but during the last seventeen years two new small estates have been built.It is unlikely that further developments will be allowed. 80% of the dwellings are owner occupied,15% are owned by scarborough Council and 5% are rented from private landlords.Several properties are for holiday letting and there is a small caravan site in the village. Most people work in the Scarborough area,Gristhorpe coming a close second with a large percentage being involved in agriculture.A high proportion of newcomers to the village are retired. There is a fairly even balance of local families and newcomers.Several local families have lived in the Gristhorpe area for generations.
